source: sf.gov DBI Permit Services — OTC step-by-step guides
description: Step-by-step OTC permit guides for residential interior, residential exterior, and commercial projects

plans_required_when: Kitchen/bathroom remodels with layout changes or wall removal
Residential interior remodels with floor plan changes
Brace and bolt seismic upgrades per DBI Info Sheet S-09
seismic_upgrade_triggers: Horizontal addition adding more than 30% to building size
Structural alterations to more than 30% of floor/roof areas
Wall/ceiling changes on more than two-thirds of building stories
Adding a third dwelling unit in below-ground basement

steps.title: Verify project eligibility
steps.detail: Confirm project type matches OTC-eligible categories

steps.title: Determine if plans are required
steps.detail: Contact techq@sfgov.org if uncertain. Bring 2 sets of plans if required.

steps.title: Evaluate seismic requirements
steps.detail: Check if project triggers earthquake safety improvements

steps.title: Complete role-based forms
steps.detail: Owners: owner package. Contractors: contractor statement form. Print and bring.

steps.title: Complete required applications
steps.detail: Building Permit Form (Form 3/8 pink form), Green Building forms, Water Use forms if applicable

steps.title: Submit at Permit Center
steps.detail: 2-8 hours processing. Bring forms and plans. Receive permit application number.

steps.title: Address plan check comments
steps.detail: Update plans per reviewer feedback. Schedule rechecks via email with assigned plan checker.

steps.title: Obtain related permits
steps.detail: Street space permits, electrical permits, plumbing permits (separate from building permit)

steps.title: Pay fees and receive job card
steps.detail: 3-4.5% of construction cost. Job card required before construction begins. Post documents at job site.

no_plans_eligible: In-kind window replacement (same size/location) — via PermitSF portal
In-kind exterior door replacement (same size/location) — via PermitSF portal
In-kind exterior siding repair/replacement — via PermitSF portal
Decks under 10ft above grade meeting Planning setbacks
Roof decks in buildable areas meeting Planning setbacks
Fences: 6+ feet in side/rear yards (max 10ft) or 3+ feet in front yards
plans_required_when: New windows or exterior doors in new locations
Facade work visible from street with finish changes
Residential security gates, bars, grills, or grates
otc_residential_exterior.planning_check_required: Use Property Information Map to verify Planning Department requirements
otc_residential_exterior.tax_incentive: Seismic retrofit work may qualify for CA property tax exclusion under Revenue and Taxation Code Section 74.5(b)(2)

not_eligible: In-kind replacements must use PermitSF portal
Other commercial projects require in-house review
required_forms: OTC building permit application (Form 3/8 pink form)

role_forms.tenants: Owner package with property owner authorization

common_notes.disabled_access: DBI now conducts disabled access review as part of plan review (no longer MOD)
common_notes.pre_permit_inspection: Homeowners may obtain confidential third-party code inspection from licensed contractor before submission
common_notes.plan_sets: Bring 2 sets of plans when required
common_notes.permit_center: 49 South Van Ness, 2nd floor, SF CA 94103
